result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon R. Bird-Duell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Conditions:  Obey rules/regulations of probation; attend, pay for, and successfully complete education or counseling as directed; all costs remitted on 15CF42 and imposed on 15CF41.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: With work release. Parties stipulated to 63 days credit.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Brandon R. Bird-Duell in court, in custody, with attorney Adrian Wayne Longacre. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Agent's recommendation is 9 months. Comments by DA and Atty. L. Court sentences def to 9 months jail. Credit: counsel stipulate to 63 days. Work release.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on September 27, 2017 at 10:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Brandon R. Bird-Duell
Current: 29011 E Richards St, Lone Rock, WI 53556 United States  (Effective: 02-10-2017)
Prior: 29011 Richard Street, Sextonville, WI 53584

Defendant Brandon R. Bird-Duell in court with attorney Gerald C. Opgenorth. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  DA Harper - State motions to revoked DPA in 15CF41 and 15CF42 for sentencing of 4 years probation; asks for dismissal without prejudice of 16CF35.  Court revokes the DPA in 15CF41 and 15CF42 and sentences def as follows:

Sentence withheld for 4 years probation.  DA states 4 years is permissible in these matters.  Conditions:  obey rules/regs; attend, pay for, and succ. complete education or counseling as directed; all costs remitted on 15CF42 and imposed on 15CF41.

16CF35 dismissed without prejudice.

Felony admonishments provided.
Motion and order to amend the court-ordered 'no contact' prohibition

15CF42, 14CF53, 15CF41, 14CF76, 14TR1263-1265 called together, along with two not-yet-filed matters.  Defendant Brandon R. Bird-Duell in court with attorney Gerald C. Opgenorth. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  DA Harper states that the parties have a plea agreement that will resolve all filed and unfiled matters, calling for pleas to four felonies, dismissal of the TR cases and def's release from bond in the two unfiled matters.  Def waives right to prelim in the felony cases.  Court's colloquy re prelim waivers.

Def pleads no contest to:

15CF42 - single count of felony bail jumping 
14CF53 - single count of take and drive vehicle w/o consent
15CF41 - felony bail jumping/count 2 
14CF76 - felony bail jumping/count 1 (charge was corrected - it is Class H felony, not Class D)

Court's colloquy on pleas.  Finding of guilty.  

Counsel address the Court.  Def addresses the Court.  

Court signs the 4-year diversion agreement for count 2 of 15CF41, count 1 of 15CF42, and count 1 of 14CF76.

In 15CF43, Court orders sentence withheld for probation of 3 years with conditions to include 6 months jail.  Must maintain absolute sobriety.  Have AODA and follow through with recommendations.  Pay court costs and costs of supervision.  Pay $3000 restitution to the named victim.  Attend, pay for, and successfully complete educational and/or treatment as required by agent.  2 week stay of jail.  Jail to begin on or before July 8, 2015 between 6-7 a.m.

TR cases dismissed.  Remaining counts dismissed.  Unfiled cases - bond vacated; cash bond to be returned to posters.

In the DPA cases, Def remains subject to bond.  Those bonds remain in effect.

Felony admonishments provided.  Def to submit to DNA sampling at the RCSD before signing up for probation.

Defendant Brandon R. Bird-Duell not in court. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Gerald C. Opgenorth in court for Defendant Brandon R. Bird-Duell.  Several cases called together:  14TR1265/status, 14TR1263/status, 14TR1264/status, 15CF42/status, 14CF76/status, 14CF53/status, and 15CF41/status; also two not-yet-filed matters.  Counsel inform the Court that they continue to work towards global resolution of these matters; adjournment requested.  Next date will be for plea/sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 24, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Brandon R. Bird-Duell in court, in custody, with attorney Gerald C. Opgenorth. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Def in court for several matters:

Initial in 15CF41
Initial in 15CF42
Status in 14TR1263, 1264, and 1265
Status in 14CF53
Status in 14CF76

Def also in court for tentative new charge of bail jumping (from 5-14-15); having a bail hrg on that matter.  Bail has been set in the other matters.

Initials conducted in 15CF41 and 15CF42.

All matters adj. to June 17 at 10 for initial in the newest bail j. matter and status in all other matters - possible resolution of all on June 17th.

DA has stated that, in addition to the 5/14/15 bail jumping, there is still one other uncharged matter.  That unfiled matter relates to the 12/5/14 RCSD B/R with $1000 cash bond that was posted by C Vonbehren.  Status conference scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 10:00 am.
